indicator.title: Output Indicator
indicator.description: National institutional and policy frameworks developed to nurture expanded use of open source software

baseline.comment: No lead institution as reference on OSS development and policy coordination.

target.comment: Improved Localization of LibreOffice and key applications

actual.comment: The OSS team has managed to improve the Liberoffice by fixing more bugs related to the RTL UI, and add new icons to SIFR theme and Convert some widgets to the new style.

target.comment: To Develop National OSS Strategy with the aim to eventually implement institutional and policy capacities at the national level

actual.comment: The National Open Source Software Strategy has been developed, and submitted for approval. It has been agreed that should the National Strategy been approved, a new Project Document will be developed and signed to support the programme to evolve into a fully functional National Center. The Project is Operationally completed in 30 June 2015.

iati-activity.title: Sustainable Road and Trasnport Management
iati-activity.description: MOT is aiming at developing sustainable transport systems and improving road safety. The project addresses two activity fields: (i) Strengthening governance through NTS reporting and review, and (ii) Capacity building for road and transport safety.

iati-activity.description: Technical assistance to the Ministry of Transport to support the implementation of the National Transport Strategy and Intelligent Transport System.

indicator.title: Output Indicator
indicator.description: Quality of transport policies and level of inter-agency coordination -Level of public transport services and use of Intelligent Transport Systems -Level of road safety and eco-friendly transport

baseline.comment: -Lack of national transport strategy to guide sector activities as focus for inter-agency coordination -No public transport in cities, and ITS capacities not developed -High levels of road death rates and high levels of vehicle pollution levels

target.comment: First National Transport Strategy Status Report prepared and ITS Training Finalized

actual.comment: The National Transport Strategy NTS reporting and review mechanism was established within the legislative process. The draft NTS Status quality report prepared and submitted to the legislative bodies. A combined training session was conducted on ITS procurement and ITS implementation

target.comment: ITS design reviewed by MOT for implementation and staff trained

actual.comment: - Final report on ITS design for Dammam Highway Traffic Management System submitted after comments by MOT. - Organized and carried out a training session for MOT on road hydrology and analysis for road design. - Report on gap analysis and need assessment for safe road design delivered to MOT.

iati-activity.title: National Energy Efficiency Programme - Phase 2
iati-activity.description: The second phase of a capacity development programme for the new Saudi Energy Efficiency Centre to develop Energy Efficiency Policy and Regulations

iati-activity.title: National Energy Efficiency Pro
iati-activity.description: Technical assistance to King Abdul-Aziz City for Science and Technology in terms of Energy Efficiency .

transaction.disbursement-channel: Money is disbursed directly to the implementing institution and managed through a separate bank account
Money is disbursed directly to the implementing institution and managed through a separate bank account

Money is disbursed directly to the implementing institution and managed through a separate bank account
Money is disbursed directly to the implementing institution and managed through a separate bank account
Money is disbursed directly to the implementing institution and managed through a separate bank account

indicator.title: Output Indicator
indicator.description: National Strategy Submitted to SEEC Board

baseline.comment: The Center is established and the Energy Efficiency Laws is drafted

target.comment: Review and completion of policies and regulations related to National Energy Efficiency Strategy

actual.comment: With Stakeholders' participation, the work is still going on Saudi Energy Efficiency Programme to develop the Energy Efficiency Strategy in KSA, which resulted in signing agreements with a number of entities to take the lead to implement the energy efficiency standards on their facilities. The National Energy Efficiency Strategic Plan will be completed and introduced at the end of year 2015.

target.comment: To develop specific policies and regulations targeting industry, buildings and transport sector and to introduce labelling standards.

actual.comment: Several Workshops to discuss the updated energy efficiency standards with a number of government entities and International consultants and agencies; ASHARE, Saudi Custom, World Bank, Shell, International Council of Clean Transportation (ICCT) Middle East Lighting Association ( MELA( and others. In addition a database for industries, light duty vehicles fuel economy label, tires and used cars was prepared. Also an awareness campaigns through media and other mean were launched to introduce the new standards for the public. The National Energy Efficiency strategic plan should be completed at the end of 2016. Furthermore, the enforcement of the new standards for white good has started in March 2015 for Washing machines and in May 2015 for the refrigerators and freezers. This enforcement is expected to reduce the electricity consumption by up to 40%. In addition w workshop was conducted with lighting manufactures and importer to introduce the lighting standards for residential sector (SASO 2870/2015). The aerodynamic regulation for heavy duty vehicles in transportation sector has been drafted.

target.comment: Enrich SFDA’s expertise by attracting, retaining and developing the appropriate human resources

actual.comment: 75% of the SFDA infrastructure has been developed and the central laboratory was connected to all ports laboratories to facilitate and speedup the examination. Number of international expert mission were conducted as a result 70% of employees level worked in the inspection of factories was raised. Project extended, efforts ongoing

target.comment: Standards control systems and polices developed to cover food, drugs and medical devices

actual.comment: GCC Rapid Alert System for Food and Feed technical requirement is done. Traceability and recall/withdrawal guidelines are also done. The Electronic system is completed and will be lunch it soon on SFDA website for all local food exporters.

indicator.title: Output Indicator
indicator.description: Adoption for ITS Plan and new waste management strategy drafted

baseline.comment: A number of ITS installations have been partially deployed but an overall plan and architecture for ITS has not been prepared. Present waste management system is lacking sustainability elements

target.comment: ITS Deployment and integration Plan for Riyadh Municipality and Waste management analysis conducted.

actual.comment: Unfortunately none of the outputs under this project were achieved, reasons are multiple: 1- Recruitment for waste management delayed 2- Recruited consultant apologized at the last minute 3- ITS recruitment had to be redone for lack of qualified candidates 4- Mayor changed and CO currently awaiting meeting with new mayor, in the meantime no decision is taken at the municipality level, hampering our work.

target.comment: No Description, awaiting instructions to close Project

actual.comment: Instructions from Municipality were sent to office to close project and return funds.

iati-activity.title: Operational Excellence
iati-activity.description: Operational Excellence for Jubail and Yanbu (RCJY) to become cities of excellence reaching the status of Best Industrial Cities globally to achieve sustainable development, provide a good life for its residents and apply best operational modalities.

indicator.title: Output Indicator
indicator.description: A comprehensive full fledge Project Document with clear focus on systematic approach to Operational Excellence prepared

baseline.comment: Original BSC KPIs (2009) never used; may now include outdated or even inappropriate KPIs; no connection to CI initiative; BSC dimensions themselves may not be appropriate for RCJY

target.comment: Assess the current situation of RCJY to identifying promising areas for the development of the operational processes and to produce a detailed and fully budgeted project document that would be used as the basis of the work the commission together with UNDP

actual.comment: A comprehensive assessment Report was submitted to the RCJY with a proposed pathway for Operational Excellence Activities. The project Document is also prepared and its under review by RCJY.

target.comment: establish the framework for effective operation of OpX division, and review the existing continuous improvement initiatives in Jubail. Results-based management will be promoted with a review of Balanced Scorecard (BSC) KPIs using the SMART framework.

actual.comment: Review & evaluate structure, activities, processes, KPIs for OpX TQM to reflect axiomatic core work was completed and job analysis and training needs assessment for OpX TQM dept to fit job descriptions was conducted. Design employee attitudes measurement instrument based on demonstrated internal reliability & construct validity. Attitudes to include organisation commitment, job commitment, job satisfaction & orientation to customers & innovation, as a minimum was completed.In addition, dedign OpX TQM Standard Operating Procedures (SOP), including: a) CI Project Document: Standard form for problem, scope of work, expected outcomes & cost-benefit analysis for business case. b) CI Project Schedule: List of value flow tasks, due dates, resources & responsibilities
